Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/set_ld.c

1/* mpfr_set_ld -- convert a machine long double to
2 a multiple precision floating-point number
3
4Copyright 2002-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
5Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
6
7This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
8
9The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
10it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
11the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
12option) any later version.
13
14The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
15WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
16or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
17License for more details.
18
19You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
20along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
21http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2251 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
23
24#include <float.h> /* needed so that MPFR_LDBL_MANT_DIG is correctly defined */
25
26#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
27#include "mpfr-impl.h"
28
29/* Various i386 systems have been seen with <float.h> LDBL constants equal
30 to the DBL ones, whereas they ought to be bigger, reflecting the 10-byte
31 IEEE extended format on that processor. gcc 3.2.1 on FreeBSD and Solaris
32 has been seen with the problem, and gcc 2.95.4 on FreeBSD 4.7. */
33
34#if HAVE_LDOUBLE_IEEE_EXT_LITTLE
35static const union {
36 char bytes[10];
37 long double d;
38} ldbl_max_struct = {
39 { '\377','\377','\377','\377',
40 '\377','\377','\377','\377',
41 '\376','\177' }
42};
43#define MPFR_LDBL_MAX (ldbl_max_struct.d)
44#else
45#define MPFR_LDBL_MAX LDBL_MAX
46#endif
47
48/* To check for +inf, one can use the test x > MPFR_LDBL_MAX, as LDBL_MAX
49 is the maximum finite number representable in a long double, according
50 to DR 467; see
51 http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg14/www/docs/n2092.htm
52 If this fails on some platform, a test x - x != 0 might be used. */
53
54#if defined(HAVE_LDOUBLE_IS_DOUBLE)
55
56/* the "long double" format is the same as "double" */
57int
58mpfr_set_ld (mpfr_ptr r, long double d, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
59{
60 return mpfr_set_d (r, (double) d, rnd_mode);
61}
62
63#elif defined(HAVE_LDOUBLE_IEEE_EXT_LITTLE)
64
65/* IEEE Extended Little Endian Code */
66int
67mpfr_set_ld (mpfr_ptr r, long double d, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
68{
69 int inexact, i, k, cnt;
70 mpfr_t tmp;
71 mp_limb_t tmpmant[MPFR_LIMBS_PER_LONG_DOUBLE];
72 mpfr_long_double_t x;
73 mpfr_exp_t exp;
74 int signd;
75 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
76
77 /* Check for NAN */
78 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (DOUBLE_ISNAN (d)))
79 {
80 MPFR_SET_NAN (r);
81 MPFR_RET_NAN;
82 }
83 /* Check for INF */
84 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (d > MPFR_LDBL_MAX))
85 {
86 MPFR_SET_INF (r);
87 MPFR_SET_POS (r);
88 return 0;
89 }
90 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (d < -MPFR_LDBL_MAX))
91 {
92 MPFR_SET_INF (r);
93 MPFR_SET_NEG (r);
94 return 0;
95 }
96 /* Check for ZERO */
97 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (d == 0.0))
98 {
99 x.ld = d;
100 MPFR_SET_ZERO (r);
101 if (x.s.sign == 1)
102 MPFR_SET_NEG(r);
103 else
104 MPFR_SET_POS(r);
105 return 0;
106 }
107
108 /* now d is neither 0, nor NaN nor Inf */
109 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
110
111 MPFR_MANT (tmp) = tmpmant;
112 MPFR_PREC (tmp) = 64;
113
114 /* Extract sign */
115 x.ld = d;
116 signd = MPFR_SIGN_POS;
117 if (x.ld < 0.0)
118 {
119 signd = MPFR_SIGN_NEG;
120 x.ld = -x.ld;
121 }
122
123 /* Extract mantissa */
124#if GMP_NUMB_BITS >= 64
125 tmpmant[0] = ((mp_limb_t) x.s.manh << 32) | ((mp_limb_t) x.s.manl);
126#else
127 tmpmant[0] = (mp_limb_t) x.s.manl;
128 tmpmant[1] = (mp_limb_t) x.s.manh;
129#endif
130
131 /* Normalize mantissa */
132 i = MPFR_LIMBS_PER_LONG_DOUBLE;
133 MPN_NORMALIZE_NOT_ZERO (tmpmant, i);
134 k = MPFR_LIMBS_PER_LONG_DOUBLE - i;
135 count_leading_zeros (cnt, tmpmant[i - 1]);
136 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (cnt != 0))
137 mpn_lshift (tmpmant + k, tmpmant, i, cnt);
138 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (k != 0))
139 MPN_COPY (tmpmant + k, tmpmant, i);
140 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (k != 0))
141 MPN_ZERO (tmpmant, k);
142
143 /* Set exponent */
144 exp = (mpfr_exp_t) ((x.s.exph << 8) + x.s.expl); /* 15-bit unsigned int */
145 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp == 0))
146 exp -= 0x3FFD;
147 else
148 exp -= 0x3FFE;
149
150 MPFR_SET_EXP (tmp, exp - cnt - k * GMP_NUMB_BITS);
151
152 /* tmp is exact */
153 inexact = mpfr_set4 (r, tmp, rnd_mode, signd);
154
155 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
156 return mpfr_check_range (r, inexact, rnd_mode);
157}
158
159#elif defined(HAVE_LDOUBLE_MAYBE_DOUBLE_DOUBLE)
160
161/* double-double code */
162int
163mpfr_set_ld (mpfr_ptr r, long double d, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
164{
165 mpfr_t t, u;
166 int inexact, shift_exp;
167 double h, l;
168 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
169
170 /* Check for NAN */
171 LONGDOUBLE_NAN_ACTION (d, goto nan);
172
173 /* Check for INF */
174 if (d > MPFR_LDBL_MAX)
175 {
176 mpfr_set_inf (r, 1);
177 return 0;
178 }
179 else if (d < -MPFR_LDBL_MAX)
180 {
181 mpfr_set_inf (r, -1);
182 return 0;
183 }
184 /* Check for ZERO */
185 else if (d == 0.0)
186 return mpfr_set_d (r, (double) d, rnd_mode);
187
188 if (d >= (long double) MPFR_LDBL_MAX || d <= (long double) -MPFR_LDBL_MAX)
189 h = (d >= (long double) MPFR_LDBL_MAX) ? MPFR_LDBL_MAX : -MPFR_LDBL_MAX;
190 else
191 h = (double) d; /* should not overflow */
192 l = (double) (d - (long double) h);
193
194 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
195
196 mpfr_init2 (t, IEEE_DBL_MANT_DIG);
197 mpfr_init2 (u, IEEE_DBL_MANT_DIG);
198
199 inexact = mpfr_set_d (t, h, MPFR_RNDN);
200 MPFR_ASSERTN(inexact == 0);
201 inexact = mpfr_set_d (u, l, MPFR_RNDN);
202 MPFR_ASSERTN(inexact == 0);
203 inexact = mpfr_add (r, t, u, rnd_mode);
204
205 mpfr_clear (t);
206 mpfr_clear (u);
207
208 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
209 inexact = mpfr_check_range (r, inexact, rnd_mode);
210 return inexact;
211
212 nan:
213 MPFR_SET_NAN(r);
214 MPFR_RET_NAN;
215}
216
217#else
218
219/* Generic code */
220int
221mpfr_set_ld (mpfr_ptr r, long double d, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
222{
223 mpfr_t t, u;
224 int inexact, shift_exp;
225 long double x;
226 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
227
228 /* Check for NAN */
229 LONGDOUBLE_NAN_ACTION (d, goto nan);
230
231 /* Check for INF */
232 if (d > MPFR_LDBL_MAX)
233 {
234 mpfr_set_inf (r, 1);
235 return 0;
236 }
237 else if (d < -MPFR_LDBL_MAX)
238 {
239 mpfr_set_inf (r, -1);
240 return 0;
241 }
242 /* Check for ZERO */
243 else if (d == 0.0)
244 return mpfr_set_d (r, (double) d, rnd_mode);
245
246 mpfr_init2 (t, MPFR_LDBL_MANT_DIG);
247 mpfr_init2 (u, IEEE_DBL_MANT_DIG);
248
249 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
250
251 convert:
252 x = d;
253 MPFR_SET_ZERO (t); /* The sign doesn't matter. */
254 shift_exp = 0; /* invariant: remainder to deal with is d*2^shift_exp */
255 while (x != (long double) 0.0)
256 {
257 /* Check overflow of double */
258 if (x > (long double) DBL_MAX || (-x) > (long double) DBL_MAX)
259 {
260 long double div9, div10, div11, div12, div13;
261
262#define TWO_64 18446744073709551616.0 /* 2^64 */
263#define TWO_128 (TWO_64 * TWO_64)
264#define TWO_256 (TWO_128 * TWO_128)
265 div9 = (long double) (double) (TWO_256 * TWO_256); /* 2^(2^9) */
266 div10 = div9 * div9;
267 div11 = div10 * div10; /* 2^(2^11) */
268 div12 = div11 * div11; /* 2^(2^12) */
269 div13 = div12 * div12; /* 2^(2^13) */
270 if (ABS (x) >= div13)
271 {
272 x /= div13; /* exact */
273 shift_exp += 8192;
274 mpfr_div_2si (t, t, 8192, MPFR_RNDZ);
275 }
276 if (ABS (x) >= div12)
277 {
278 x /= div12; /* exact */
279 shift_exp += 4096;
280 mpfr_div_2si (t, t, 4096, MPFR_RNDZ);
281 }
282 if (ABS (x) >= div11)
283 {
284 x /= div11; /* exact */
285 shift_exp += 2048;
286 mpfr_div_2si (t, t, 2048, MPFR_RNDZ);
287 }
288 if (ABS (x) >= div10)
289 {
290 x /= div10; /* exact */
291 shift_exp += 1024;
292 mpfr_div_2si (t, t, 1024, MPFR_RNDZ);
293 }
294 /* warning: we may have DBL_MAX=2^1024*(1-2^(-53)) < x < 2^1024,
295 therefore we have one extra exponent reduction step */
296 if (ABS (x) >= div9)
297 {
298 x /= div9; /* exact */
299 shift_exp += 512;
300 mpfr_div_2si (t, t, 512, MPFR_RNDZ);
301 }
302 } /* Check overflow of double */
303 else /* no overflow on double */
304 {
305 long double div9, div10, div11;
306
307 div9 = (long double) (double) 7.4583407312002067432909653e-155;
308 /* div9 = 2^(-2^9) */
309 div10 = div9 * div9; /* 2^(-2^10) */
310 div11 = div10 * div10; /* 2^(-2^11) if extended precision */
311 /* since -DBL_MAX <= x <= DBL_MAX, the cast to double should not
312 overflow here */
313 if (ABS(x) < div10 &&
314 div11 != (long double) 0.0 &&
315 div11 / div10 == div10) /* possible underflow */
316 {
317 long double div12, div13;
318 /* After the divisions, any bit of x must be >= div10,
319 hence the possible division by div9. */
320 div12 = div11 * div11; /* 2^(-2^12) */
321 div13 = div12 * div12; /* 2^(-2^13) */
322 if (ABS (x) <= div13)
323 {
324 x /= div13; /* exact */
325 shift_exp -= 8192;
326 mpfr_mul_2si (t, t, 8192, MPFR_RNDZ);
327 }
328 if (ABS (x) <= div12)
329 {
330 x /= div12; /* exact */
331 shift_exp -= 4096;
332 mpfr_mul_2si (t, t, 4096, MPFR_RNDZ);
333 }
334 if (ABS (x) <= div11)
335 {
336 x /= div11; /* exact */
337 shift_exp -= 2048;
338 mpfr_mul_2si (t, t, 2048, MPFR_RNDZ);
339 }
340 if (ABS (x) <= div10)
341 {
342 x /= div10; /* exact */
343 shift_exp -= 1024;
344 mpfr_mul_2si (t, t, 1024, MPFR_RNDZ);
345 }
346 if (ABS(x) <= div9)
347 {
348 x /= div9; /* exact */
349 shift_exp -= 512;
350 mpfr_mul_2si (t, t, 512, MPFR_RNDZ);
351 }
352 }
353 else /* no underflow */
354 {
355 inexact = mpfr_set_d (u, (double) x, MPFR_RNDZ);
356 MPFR_ASSERTD (inexact == 0);
357 if (mpfr_add (t, t, u, MPFR_RNDZ) != 0)
358 {
359 if (!mpfr_number_p (t))
360 break;
361 /* Inexact. This cannot happen unless the C implementation
362 "lies" on the precision or when long doubles are
363 implemented with FP expansions like double-double on
364 PowerPC. */
365 if (MPFR_PREC (t) != MPFR_PREC (r) + 1)
366 {
367 /* We assume that MPFR_PREC (r) < MPFR_PREC_MAX.
368 The precision MPFR_PREC (r) + 1 allows us to
369 deduce the rounding bit and the sticky bit. */
370 mpfr_set_prec (t, MPFR_PREC (r) + 1);
371 goto convert;
372 }
373 else
374 {
375 mp_limb_t *tp;
376 int rb_mask;
377
378 /* Since mpfr_add was inexact, the sticky bit is 1. */
379 tp = MPFR_MANT (t);
380 rb_mask = MPFR_LIMB_ONE <<
381 (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1 -
382 (MPFR_PREC (r) & (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)));
383 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
384 rnd_mode = (*tp & rb_mask) ^ MPFR_IS_NEG (t) ?
385 MPFR_RNDU : MPFR_RNDD;
386 *tp |= rb_mask;
387 break;
388 }
389 }
390 x -= (long double) mpfr_get_d1 (u); /* exact */
391 }
392 }
393 }
394 inexact = mpfr_mul_2si (r, t, shift_exp, rnd_mode);
395 mpfr_clear (t);
396 mpfr_clear (u);
397
398 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
399 return mpfr_check_range (r, inexact, rnd_mode);
400
401 nan:
402 MPFR_SET_NAN(r);
403 MPFR_RET_NAN;
404}
405
406#endif
407
